samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: The R programming language was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. The first version was released in 1993. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names and is also a play on the name of the S programming language, which R was designed to be an implementation of. R has since evolved through the R Development Core Team and is now maintained by the R Foundation for Statistical Computing.

R has since evolved through the R Development Core Team and is now maintained by the R Foundation for Statistical Computing.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of the R statistical programming language after its initial development by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of the R statistical programming language after its initial development by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s.

Since the submission contains the core factual content from the expert answer (that R 1.0 was released in 2000), the submission is correct. The additional information doesn't contradict the expert answer; it merely elaborates on it.

GRADE: C
